text: Dalbergia velutinaBentham G (1852) Pl. Jungh. [Miquel] 2: 255. (synonym D. pierreanaGagnepain F (1913) In:Lecomte,H.(ed.), Flore Generale de L'Indochine 2, 2.) is a species of liana. The genus Dalbergia is placed in the subfamily Faboideae and tribe Dalbergieae. The recorded range of this species is from Assam to southern China, Indochina and Peninsula Malaysia. In Vietnam it may be known under its synonym Dalbergia pierreana or trắc Pierre. ==Varieties== Plants of the World Online currently includes:Plants of the World Online: Dalbergia velutina Benth. (retrieved 10 October 2020) * Dalbergia velutina var. succirubra (Gagnep. & Craib) Niyomdham * Dalbergia velutina var. verrucosa (Craib) Niyomdham (Thailand) == References == Phạm Hoàng Hộ (1999) Cây Cỏ Việt Nam: an Illustrated Flora of Vietnam vol. I publ. Nhà Xuẩt Bản Trẻ, HCMC, VN. ==External Links== * Category:Flora of Indo-China
title: Dalbergia velutina
